results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (1 <= k <= n) defined by T(n,n) = (n-1)^(n-1), T(n,k) = T(n,k+1) - (n-1)*T(n-1,k) for k = n-1 .. 1.
comment: Arises in analysis of game with n players: each person picks a number from 1 to n, and the winner is the largest unique choice (see Guy's letter). T(n,k) is the number out of all possible games (i.e., all n^n sets of choices) which are won by a given player who has chosen k.
link: R. K. Guy, Letter to N. J. A. Sloane, Jun 21, 1975
maple: for n from 2 to M do
for k from n-1 by -1 to 1 do
for n from 1 to M2 do lprint([seq(T[n,k],k=1..n)]); od:
xref: T(n,0) is A231797, row sums are A241581.
